title: 34 Cuban immigrants come ashore in South Fla.
body:
U.S. Border Patrol authorities have taken 34 people, reportedly from Cuba, into custody after they came ashore on 
a beach in South Florida.

The immigrants arrived in Ocean Ridge, about 15 miles south of West Palm Beach, on a 28-foot boat early 
Sunday.

John Dair, a supervisory agent, says they saw a light on in an apartment and notified the occupants. Police were 
called to the scene and all 34 people were taken into custody.

Dair says all reported being Cuban citizens.

Under the U.S. Cuban Adjustment Act, most Cubans who reach U.S. soil are allowed to stay.

The immigrants included 16 adult men, 13 adult women and five children. They were being processed at 
immigration centers Sunday evening.
